summary_markdown:
# About Quartet Health

Quartet Health is a behavioral healthcare company founded on January 1, 2014, and is based in New York, United States [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/quartet-health). The company focuses on improving access to high-quality mental health care through a tech-enabled platform that connects patients with appropriate care providers. Quartet Health partners with health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers across 39 states in the U.S. to deliver comprehensive behavioral health solutions [(Quartet Health on 2024-09-20)](https://www.quartethealth.com/).

Quartet Health operates primarily in the B2B space, serving clients such as health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers [(Quartet Health on 2024-09-20)](https://www.quartethealth.com/). The company generates revenue by providing these organizations with a platform that facilitates the identification, engagement, and care of patients with behavioral health needs. Quartet Health's services include psychiatric evaluations, therapy, medication management, and patient education, enhanced by its acquisition of innovaTel, a telepsychiatry provider, in 2021 [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

The company has raised a total of $265 million in funding, with the most recent round being $51 million on February 17, 2022 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/quartet-health). Quartet Health's scale is significant, as it is described as a leading company in the behavioral health space, although specific employee numbers are not detailed [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

Quartet Health's products are distributed through partnerships with health plans and systems, which help connect patients with high-quality providers, including Quartet's own medical group [(Quartet Health on 2024-09-20)](https://www.quartethealth.com/). The company is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within its workforce, fostering a culture that reflects these values [(Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Quartet on 2021-10-18)](https://www.quartethealth.com/dei/).

# Key Personnel

- **Christina Mainelli**: CEO of Quartet Health. Mainelli has been instrumental in shaping the company's vision and strategy, particularly in addressing the interconnectedness of physical and mental health needs [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).
- **Dr. Michael J. Lipp**: Chief Medical Officer. Dr. Lipp emphasizes the importance of coordinated and comprehensive care for patients with serious mental illnesses [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).
- **Karen Mitchell**: Chief Growth Officer, announced in February 2024 [(Quartet Health, 2024-02-15)](https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/quartet-health-announces-karen-mitchell-as-chief-growth-officer-302062185.html).

# News

## Recent Developments

- **Whole Health Program Launch**: On March 19, 2024, Quartet Health launched its Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health. This program aims to provide comprehensive care for patients with serious mental illnesses by integrating physical and mental health services [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/). The program is designed to offer coordinated care, including 24/7 access, medication support, and local community resources [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Partnerships and Collaborations

- **Clover Health Partnership**: The partnership with Clover Health is significant as it targets a traditionally underserved patient population. The Whole Health program is the first fully integrated model that takes accountability for the total cost of care (TCOC) risk on health plans’ most complex members [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Other News

- **Arbital Health Partnership**: Quartet Health partnered with Arbital Health to increase value-based mental healthcare [(Mobi Health News, 2024-10-17)](https://www.mobihealthnews.com/news/arbital-health-quartet-health-partner-increase-value-based-mental-healthcare).
- **Company Culture**: Quartet Health promotes a culture of empowerment and inclusivity, actively working to challenge biases and build a diverse team [(Comparably, 2024-02-18)](https://www.comparably.com/companies/quartet-health).

Quartet Health continues to innovate and expand its offerings in the behavioral health sector, with a strong focus on integrating physical and mental health care. The company's recent initiatives and partnerships highlight its commitment to improving healthcare delivery and patient outcomes.

webpage_result.summary_markdown:
# Quartet Health Summary

## Company Overview
Quartet Health is a leading value-based behavioral healthcare company focused on expanding access to high-quality care for individuals with behavioral health needs, including serious mental illness. The company aims to improve the lives of patients through whole-person care and innovative solutions that navigate the complex mental health landscape. Quartet partners with health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers across 39 states in the U.S. to deliver comprehensive behavioral health solutions [(Quartet Health on 2024-09-20)](https://www.quartethealth.com/).

## Services and Products
- **Care Enablement and Delivery**: Quartet provides an end-to-end behavioral health solution that identifies, engages, and cares for patients.
- **Partnerships**: The company collaborates with various health plans and systems to connect patients with high-quality providers, including its own medical group.

## Customers
Quartet Health serves a diverse range of clients, including:
- Health plans
- Health systems
- Community mental health centers

## Leadership Team
While specific details about the leadership team were not provided in the available content, the company emphasizes a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) within its workforce, fostering a culture that reflects these values [(Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Quartet on 2021-10-18)](https://www.quartethealth.com/dei/).

## Company Culture
Quartet Health promotes a culture of empowerment and inclusivity. The organization actively works to challenge biases and build a team that reflects its commitment to DEI. Employee resource groups (ERGs) are part of this initiative, fostering a strong sense of belonging among employees [(Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Quartet on 2021-10-18)](https://www.quartethealth.com/dei/).

## Security and Privacy
Quartet Health prioritizes the security of sensitive data and adheres to regulatory requirements such as HIPAA and HITECH. The company utilizes Amazon Web Services (AWS) for data storage and processing, ensuring high standards of security and reliability [(Quartet Health on 2021-08-06)](https://www.quartethealth.com/security/).

## Conclusion
Quartet Health is dedicated to improving behavioral healthcare access and quality through innovative solutions and strong partnerships. The company's commitment to DEI and data security further enhances its role as a trusted partner in the healthcare landscape.
page_markdowns:
# [Quartet Health on 2024-09-20](https://www.quartethealth.com/)
Quartet Health is an industry-leading value-based behavioral healthcare company. We expand access to and deliver high-quality care for people with behavioral health needs, including serious mental illness. Quartet’s care enablement and delivery offerings seek to improve the lives of patients by providing whole, human, behavioral health care to those in need.

Our innovative approaches to navigating the complex mental health landscape enable us to identify, engage, and care for patients and deliver an end-to-end behavioral health solution. We are a trusted partner of health plans, health systems, and community mental health centers that serve patients in 39 states across the country.

# [Quartet Health on 2021-08-06](https://www.quartethealth.com/security/)
At Quartet, we recognize the highly sensitive nature of data entrusted to us by our partners. We also recognize the regulatory requirements set forth by HIPAA / HITECH and industry best practices and standards (e.g., AICPA Trust Services Principles and ISO27001/ 2) and strive to meet and exceed those requirements. The goal of this Security Statement is to ensure transparency regarding our security practices, and to help reassure you that your data is appropriately protected.

You may report security issues to us at [email protected]

Quartet utilizes Amazon Web Services (“AWS”) in order to take advantage of the elasticity, reliability and security of the AWS Infrastructure as a cloud service.

All data is stored and processed through AWS’ certified-secure facilities:

AWS hosting facilities are SOC Type 1 & 2 certified and certified to meet ISO standards

AWS hosting facilities accessible only by biometric scanning

24/ 7 monitoring by security guards

24/ 7 video surveillance

Thanks for your interest in Quartet!

We've received your details, and will let you know when we're in your area.

To learn more about your mental health, visit your Resources page.

# Quartet Health, founded 2014-01-01 [(Crunchbase, 2025)](https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/quartet-health)
Quartet is a platform that makes it easier for people to get the best mental health care for them. The best care should fit their preferences and clinical needs, take their insurance, and link to the rest of their healthcare experience.

Quartet was founded in 2014 and is based in  New York, United States.

reviews.cons: Lots to learn. Multiple interlocking systems, lots of knowledge. Broad responsibilities. Good if you are easily bored.
reviews.pros: Good company. They care about their employees. What they do helps the world. Good pay and benefits. Unlimited PTO you can actually use. Great diversity.

reviews.advice: communicate expectations
reviews.cons: work until 6 pm twice a week
reviews.pros: Decent insurance benefits are available

reviews.advice: Not worth wasting the words. They don't care. This will be explained as just another "disgruntled former employee."
reviews.cons:
EVERYTHING else.
No co culture. Killed when they ousted the former CEO. ERGs are defunct - they laid off everyone involved over the course of two years. No one cares enough about the company or culture to try.
Management decreases benefits about every 6 months. Raises are paltry. Everything from company holidays to vacation time constantly stripped back for non-leadership employees. Ask someone about the Juneteenth or maternity leave debates. It will tell you everything you need to know.
Continue to claim "start up" status only because they are floundering for a strategy they can monetize. Total lack a consistent roadmap, because the strategy is changes yearly. 
Ever-increasing workload shoveled on the few employees not laid off with no increase in compensation or titles. Employee stratification undervalues everyone except leadership. Use that that to refuse to compensate employees for the additional work demanded of them.
Commitment to DEI is a lie, especially at the leadership level. All management hiring based on knowing the existing management team. Very white, hetero, male. Don't let the current female CEO fool you.
HR team tries, but they are handcuffed by leadership. As long as an employee is "producing" or part of the leadership circle, bad behavior is excused. Repeat offenders sit on the leadership team, and the people that reported leave rather than fight a losing battle. 
If you want real nightmares, know they laid off people on maternity/paternity leave, and laid off an employee that was literally weeks from her due date. That is the leadership you're getting here.
reviews.pros: Coworkers are some of the best. Dedicated to the mental health of their users.
reviews.summary: The bad reviews are real, no matter what management says

reviews.advice: Offer coaching to all associates in C-suite, Senior Leadership, and in Executive Support to better align messaging and execution, as well as to provide cohesive understanding of business etiquette.
reviews.cons:
- There are some associates who do not pull their weight in comparison to others (same as everywhere).
 - There are a handful of developing leaders who do not credit contributors as they should, which causes occasional resentment.
 - The business is constantly changing, resulting in burnout for some associates.
reviews.pros:
- The vast majority of people working at Quartet Health are friendly, kind, and extremely hard-working. 
 - Leadership is dedicated to growing a successful company while improving the lives of the people in the Behavioral Health population. 
 - The salaries/benefits are competitive.
 - The teamwork in my area is probably the strongest and most supportive of any company I have ever worked at during my career.

reviews.cons: -The only major con of working here has been some of the uncertainty with lay-offs last year... However, the whole industry experienced similar things, and Quartet has adapted well and is moving forward leaner and stronger than ever, allowing for more runway to "make it." And it seems we finally have the right people on board.
reviews.pros:
-A lot of smart and dedicated people work here. However, the culture is not overly stuffy and there is no air of pretentiousness like at some start-ups / growth stage companies
-The mission of expanding access to quality mental healthcare is at the core of the business and most of the employees care greatly about this
-The work is interesting, as there are multiple product lines and plenty of analytically interesting challenges to overcome, as with any business striving for maturation and sustainable profitability
-The business is fully remote, and work-life balance is good. Even in busy times with long hours for a period of time, the flexibility of being remote to take breaks during the day and get things done later makes it bearable long-term
reviews.summary: Good People, Great Mission, Interesting Work

reviews.cons: Virtual-first working style isn't for everyone, but HR and leadership continue to find ways to foster a strong sense of community. There are regional meet-ups and budget for team building activities.
reviews.pros:
Quartet Health has a very mission & purpose-driven culture. The people who work here are passionate about improving access to quality healthcare for everyone. Each monthly all-employee Town Hall meeting starts with a Patient story to highlight the impact we're making in people's lives. Instances where employees demonstrate our Corporate values are also recognized each meeting.

There has been strong continuity among senior leadership the last few years and they have cast a compelling vision of the future to strengthen alignment at all levels on the pathway forward.
reviews.summary: Great place to make an impact in the communities we serve & grow your career

reviews.advice: Keep up the great work! Continue to listen, be responsive, and value employees, clients, and patients as Quartet continues to grow. Staying flexible to respond to market needs and opportunities will ensure we remain successful.
reviews.cons: Honestly, I can't think of any major downsides to working at Quartet Health.
reviews.pros: Quartet Health is a fantastic place to work, and I get to work with a wonderful group of talented people. My direct leader creates a supportive environment, offering plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and growth, which makes me feel truly valued. The work we do here has a real impact, and it's incredibly rewarding to see the difference we make. Additionally, the senior and executive leadership genuinely listens to us, which is a rare and appreciated quality.
reviews.summary: A Great Place to Work with Amazing People

reviews.cons: Top down approach to management
reviews.pros: Great colleagues to work with

reviews.cons: Change can stress folks out. Its personally not a con for me but I know for others rapid change is difficult.
reviews.pros: The team is great in total. Whether its your direct team or working crossfunctionally, everyone is generally pleasant to work with. Its very flexible, everyone is understanding of work/life balance. Leadership is sharp.

reviews.cons:
-No raise or cost of living adjustment in 2 years
-Do not know how to value employees.
-"Start up culture" (roll out new initiatives, not the best communication, focus on growth-but not on retention)
-Christmas Bonus was a certificate valued up to $20 to a website (options included 1 of the following: a pair of socks, a wick trimmer, wool dryer balls, a bar of fancy chocolate, a few tea bags, a 'boutique' car air freshener, and a few other miscellaneous items)
reviews.pros:
-Meaningful work
-Clinical leadership is solid

reviews.advice: There isn’t any advice the management team hasn’t heard, acknowledged and IGNORED. Its completely pointless to bring anything up because it’s routinely ignored or turned around and blamed on Care Navigation.
reviews.cons:
9/2022 UPDATE: Quartet is now taking away our unlimited PTO and our salaried positions. They are moving all of the Care Navigation/ Customer Support Staff team to hourly positions. They have given us 9 days notice and we will go without full pay while they do this. Quartet Health is the WORST company I have ever worked for. They lie, make up fake laws and only pay or reward upper management. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT MENTAL HEALTH AT ALL. 


They continue to advertise “unlimited pto”. However this just isn’t true. If you’re a manager or above then yes, have at it. If you’re on the Care Navigation team or the Customer Support Staff who answer phones they will not give you time off. 
They count literally everyday you are off and have a point system for those who they deem unworthy to use their “unlimited pto”. It’s now the WORST Pto plan I’ve had in 20 years in health care. 

They have also taken our 15 holidays a year and reduced it to 6. Which is well below the National average for holidays allowed per year. 

The management staff have absolutely no idea how difficult the roles are speaking to the patients on a daily basis. The burn out rate is very high due to their unrealistic metrics. Also- most patients are not cared for simply because they have the “wrong” insurance and Quartet doesn’t get paid. This place is a complete waste of time for most patients and employees. If you want to feel like the sludge at the bottom of a pond, join Quartet!
reviews.pros: The pros are pretty simple, you work from home. Which in all honesty isn’t such a pro anymore with so many companies offering this. That’s the only pro.
reviews.summary: Quartet Health; the mental health company that cares NOTHING about mental health!

reviews.advice:
It's a classic case of not taking care of your employees. Leadership has no idea what employees do and how they speak/assist patients all day every day. It is incredibly taxing work. 

Employees talk amongst themselves and morale is incredibly low. Never worked at a place with such low morale as here. They talk about quitting, burnout, and dread of coming into work every day. 

Implement real changes like higher salaries, less micro management, better work life balance, and adjusted metrics. 

The work Quartet does is important but the culture and environment isn't helpful to the mission. 

Bad employee experience = bad patient experience. Quite obvious but this seems like a concept that hasn't yet been realized by leadership.
reviews.cons:
- There's a lot of micro management because they are so focused on metrics. It creates extreme burnout, stress, and overall just a horrible time while at work. The metrics goals are not sustainable and unreachable. 

- The salary is laughable. For the type and amount of work that is required, they do not pay well. People make a lot more doing a lot less elsewhere. 

-The bonuses are also laughable. Almost impossible to attain because it's based on unrealistic goals. You have to work like a robot and still you may not reach them. Yet they wonder why no one's metrics are met. 

- Turnover rate is incredibly high. Management changes, poorly thought out metrics and workflows, and a lot of the jobs themselves are horrible to do. Always understaffed due to high turnover. 

- Out of Touch Leadership: Great lip service but that's about it. Employees are miserable yet leadership thinks everything is great. For Employee Appreciation Day, let's just say their show of appreciation became a running joke in the company.
reviews.pros:
Pros:
The coworkers are some of the nicest, well intentioned, true advocates of mental health you'll ever meet. 

Benefits are okay. Health plans are decent and they reimburse a lot of expenses. 

Pretty much it.
reviews.summary: Nice People but Horrible Expectations and Pay

reviews.advice: Complete overhaul of the culture.
reviews.cons: Everything is horrendous at Quartet
reviews.pros: Run! Do not work there. Management does not care about your well being.

reviews.cons: too much focus on brand over substance & products
reviews.pros: Fast paced environment; opportunities for growth and development.

reviews.advice: Change doesn't happen in a day, but stay focused on what we commit to (to our team and our clients). Changing strategy is not always translated well to people's day to day, or thought through at that level. I agree with some of the other reviews that more questions should be asked of those actually doing the work prior to major changes.
reviews.cons:
- Like others said, Quartet recently hired groups of people from Aspire and similar places. I agree we should expand our horizons to keep adding diverse talent
-The 401(k) match should be increased
- Some of the leaders (high level, the managers are usually great) are better than others. My advice is to ask thoughtful questions about your executive leadership when interviewing here

None of these are dealbreakers for me, so I'm keeping my rating at 5 stars, but realistically it's probably between 4-5 stars based on some of the cons.
reviews.pros:
Quartet is one of many players in the health tech-enabled space. It's not for everyone, but I think it has a lot going for it. My experience at Quartet has had quite a few "pros."

- Smart and kind people across the board. Feeling like you can reach out to anyone with a question is paid lip service at other companies, but it's real here
- Inspiring mission, evolving strategy. Shifting strategy is frustrating, but the new strategy is objectively clearer, and I understand how we plan to make money with the new changes. Before...not so much 
- New, interesting challenges. This probably isn't true for every role or team, but I think my day-to-day is rich with new experiences
- I'm not patient-facing, so my view is limited, but I think we highlight our patient wins well and often. I love hearing about the indirect impact of my work on someone getting the care they need

I feel like you could throw a stone and hit 10 other companies "similar" to Quartet (Cerebral, Ginger, Alma, etc). I like what we're doing differently, the people, and my work, so it's a great match for me. Maybe it's not for you, but I'd take other reviews with a grain of salt and find out for yourself.
reviews.summary: Lots of change, but lots of positives as well

reviews.advice: I appreciate that our CEO, Arun, is diligent about feedback and working hard to maintain transparency into what we do. I encourage all our upper management to follow his lead and be open to critique and improvement, because that's how we'll succeed as a company.
reviews.cons: Only major con is for the company to carefully scale upwards and not just expand in response to some external force. I know that with new clients and funding comes the itch to grow, but we must do so responsibly. We have to make sure to continue to bring in people that we have a place for, and not just hire to meet some quota. I think we're doing a good job with that now, but as we continue to expand let's be sure to keep the caliber high!
reviews.pros: I find myself incredibly impressed with the culture that Quartet has fostered. Here is a company that recognizes we're not trying to be a superficial app to make a quick buck, nor are we trying to be an over-the-top informal startup with scooters and ball pits. We're the right mix of formality (i.e. leadership that consists of former CEOs, upper management from the country's largest insurers and payers) that is important to help legitimize us to our clients and lean start-up (i.e. experienced engineers, data scientists, developers, technical staff from the startup world) who are driven by our personal connections to mental health in our own lives and our families. I find myself fulfilled in my job because of the varied and engaging work, along with the autonomy that is given which affirms the value of the employees.

reviews.cons: No pay transparency within company. Lack of communication from higher up
reviews.pros: Good benefits, wonderful coworkers, good hours

reviews.advice: Keep the mission front and center for employees
reviews.cons: There are some growing pains, and Quartet has expanded very quickly while still trying to figure out how to maintain the dynamic that kept the company functioning smoothly when it was younger. More management training for new managers has been implemented, and it'll be important to see how that makes things better. The stakes are high as we're working directly with people's health, which must be balanced against the desire of the company to iterate quickly and experiment with new approaches where many employees don't come in from the healthcare industry. Greater reliance of health/clinical domain knowledge will allow Quartet to make decisions more relevant and beneficial to users.
reviews.pros: Quartet is tacking a critical problem in mental health, and has brought in a great team to do so. For many people here, mental health isn't something abstract. Sometimes it's substance abuse from a family member, sometimes a past experience with a broken healthcare system for depression. The personal connection from so many employees, from top to bottom, means that there's a sense that the products we're building must work and work well. I found it incredibly refreshing as it creates a culture of excellence, and it helps that you can directly see the impact of your work from the patient feedback we get every day. There's a lot of interest from insurance companies and provider groups about the work we do, and investors are recognizing the value that we bring.
reviews.summary: Working on an important mission with a great, committed group of people

reviews.advice:
Continue supporting the culture and reiterating the mission as often as you can. Putting everything we do every day in the context of solving mental healthcare helps drive us and keep us focused.

Also, continue to grow out the management and leadership teams to better support the team.
reviews.cons: This kind of environment isn't for everyone. This team moves quickly and empowers you to make your own decisions and take responsibility for them. The product is rapidly evolving and it sometimes feels like the ground underneath you isn't solid. It takes someone who works well with ambiguity and change to not let it get to them, and help this team solidify our position in the market.
reviews.pros:
Quartet is a unicorn in the tech startup industry. It's only ~2 years old, and it already has a well defined culture that is bought into by everyone across the organization. It has a matured data/engineering/product team that is using live data and user feedback to drive roadmap decisions, and an engineering stack that would attract anyone in the web application field. The entire team is anchored around the idea that we are delivering real value to our users by getting them in the door to receiving behavioral healthcare and lowering their insurance premiums.

You don't often find a company this vibrant who is actually delivering on a mission for the social good.
reviews.summary: A Tech Startup with a Mission for Social Good

reviews.cons: Difficult team dynamics, uncertain product, unprofessionalism
reviews.pros: Good problem to solve, motivated people, and flexible

reviews.cons: The whole job was very difficult and stressful I did not trust it
reviews.pros: The task and the ask not real. Felt like a scam very worried

reviews.advice: Treat your employees like you use to. Most of the great talent has left or is going to leave. Why be the Walmart of digital health when you could be Target.
reviews.cons: In my time with the company they have slowly chipped away at the benefits package they offered. When I first started unlimited PTO was standard along with other great benefits. We recently have been told that we will no longer be receiving such a benefit. Along with that they have changed us from a salaried position to hourly. It is in my opinion that Quartet no longer cares about the employees who do the brunt of the work and are more about the bottom line. I’d think twice before apply here.
reviews.pros:
- Coworkers
- Working from home
- Mission Driven

reviews.cons: Terrible admin. Lie. Cheap. Likely bankrupt in 2 years. Poor fiscal management.
reviews.pros: None. None. None. None. None.
reviews.summary: Worst company I've ever worked for.

reviews.cons: It's not a good place for you if you can't adapt to change.
reviews.pros: - Great people - Great opportunity for growth

reviews.cons: The con is also a pro in being remote. Its nice to work from home but you only get virtual interactions
reviews.pros: One team that works well together across all positions

reviews.advice: None! Continue working to promote transparency and a culture of One Team!
reviews.cons: None that I'm aware of at this time.
reviews.pros:
The company is very mission driven and you can feel that in every interaction. 
One of our core values is that we are One Team and you can truly feel that when working cross-functionally. 
Leadership has done an amazing job at taking previous feedback and implementing it to make them more available to employees by creating monthly office hours where employees can learn about what the strategy for that department looks like. 

In my 10+ years in the corporate world I can truly say that Quartet has been the best company I've ever worked for. I have never felt more valued in a corporate setting as I do at Quartet.

reviews.cons: Limited room for growth Benefits that are not aligned with rest of the company.
reviews.pros: Nice coworkers, remote work environment

reviews.cons: Management is mostly from traditional/large companies. Startup culture is slowly fading. Hiring for non-clinical roles has dried up.
reviews.pros: Has been an exciting place to work since its acquisition last year of Innovatel. Lots of new opportunities and initiatives that feel like we're heading in the right directions. Culture is very strongly positive.

reviews.cons: Quartet is struggling to find product market fit. Some of its products are useful and impactful , some are a solution in search of a problem.
reviews.pros: Small company , ability to make a big impact , learn a lot , and take charge of features / bug fixes. I generally liked all the people i worked with , especially the other engineers , but everyone else was hard working and cared about the mission. I don’t have a lot bad to say about the company . WLB was excellent. If you’re an early career engineer that wants to work on a mature product that still has a lot of feature work available, start here

reviews.cons: Consistently re-organizing and re-structuring; loyalty not rewarded; current CEO (Puneet Singh) and other leadership failed to push the envelope, innovate, retain customers, or derive any profit; strong decline in company culture; lack of/minimal 401K matching
reviews.pros: Great work-life balance; good health insurance coverage; excellent mental health resources

reviews.advice: It doesn’t matter. They don’t care. They’re probably trying to save even their own jobs! That’s how downhill it’s going.
reviews.cons: Here we go again, another round of unexpected lay offs. This company does not care about patients let alone employees. It’s all about money because they know they are going downhill. The CEOs, upper management and HR completely blindsided everyone else. The way they treated us when they did the lay offs last week was unbelievable, we weren’t given the opportunity to even say goodbye to co-workers who we’ve worked with for years! I truly feel like this company will no longer be around in a year. They are running out of money. Do yourself a favor and run far away from this place.
reviews.pros: Remote. Paid Holidays. Friendly Co-workers.
reviews.summary: Layoffs again, no explanation, no warnings. Nothing.

reviews.advice: Advice? Does it matter???? You have had people leave ON THE SPOT with no jobs lined up, not waiting for bonuses because their mental health was suffering under your leadership. Then the employees that do stay with you, you blindside, use, and lie to. GIVE THAT EMPLOYEE HER EARNED MATERNITY LEAVE, YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES!
reviews.cons: WOW. Because WOW is the only reaction to how hypocritical this company is. They do not care about the mental health of their employees. To prove how heartless they are, during another round of layoffs they laid off an employee who is nine months pregnant! By the time she is due she won’t even be covered under health insurance anymore! I wonder how management would feel if they were in her shoes. Heartless and hypocritical are the only words I have for this company and everyone sitting in management. This is NOT the Quartet it used to be. The vision is blurred, most of the talent has left or been laid off and they do not care about patients who are not contracted with insurances Quartet makes money off of.
reviews.pros: There are no pros anymore. If zero stars were an option I would’ve chose it.

reviews.advice: If a mistake is made, don't assume the worst and inquire to the person you are accusing instead of blindsiding them with punishment.
reviews.cons: Management lacks care for their employees and they use you when they need you but when you are no longer needed, say goodbye to job security. They make false promises and will blindside you with "transitions" by making decisions about YOUR job and its status behind your back. Not to mention, they lack genuine care for their patients unless they are contracted. Extremely money driven yet refuse to give raises despite increase cost of living. Continue to remove benefits such as unlimited PTO. Did I mention that you are never guaranteed time off even if you request it? Overall, as others have said, this company is going down. They have lost their transparency and specialty, becoming a corporate business driven outlook who does not care about their workers.
reviews.pros: The coworkers are extremely kind and willing to answer any questions you have, will help get you on your feet and truly care for you (unlike management/ those in higher level positions)
reviews.summary: Lack Of Care For Employees, Blindsiding Managers

reviews.advice: Kick rocks. Honestly. Nothing you’re doing is working and you’re all going to be jobless in a year or two.
reviews.cons: Everything. Quite possibly the WORST COMPANY in the health tech space and the worst company I’ve ever worked for. Unexpected lay offs. No explanation. Not a care in the world. Their crappy reviews were even brought up to management and they just stated that they were received from disgruntled employees. Yeah… okay. Do not work for this company. Horrid. Just absolutely horrid.
reviews.pros: Coworkers-not including management (that’s a given, I know)

reviews.cons: Leadership seems reactionary and failure to commit to a single business strategy has led to several rounds of layoffs.
reviews.pros: Great employees, admirable mission. The people I worked with were all wonderful and thoughtful.

reviews.advice: Honestly it's too far gone.
reviews.cons: So I'm re-writing my review from Jan 2022 where I said things were looking up-- LOL JOKES ON ME. The company has completely gone down hill, it is not profitable and their revised business model does not work. So there is absolutely no job security. They just went through a second round of layoffs in the two years I've been at the company, meaning things have just been getting worst. Leadership does not care about employees or company culture. This is not a mission driven company any more, they DO NOT even care or prioritize their own employees mental health so please tell me how the heck would they be able to care about other's mental health ? This place is a dumpster fire and it's truly sad. I'd stay away as you may end up unemployed in a short amount of time given the state of the business.
reviews.pros: Once upon a time my team was amazing, as well as my manager.

reviews.advice: None - what a CN says absolutely does not matter.
reviews.cons: Constantly micromanaged, like at an incredible rate you couldn’t even imagine. Managers must just sit there and refresh their dashboards all day to see what they can message you about to met one metric or another. The only thing that matters is numbers and metrics. Not you, not the patients, nothing else. Benefits used to be great and got worse over time. I’m actually not even sure how this company is still afloat given a lack of proper execution amid a great vision.
reviews.pros: Remote work place Other teammates

reviews.cons: Everything about working there, the leadership, the pay.
reviews.pros: NONE, the company is a failure

reviews.cons: Company is not making money. 7 people in a meeting to discuss $3,000 yearly charge.
reviews.pros: Small company benefits - access to leadership, voice heard across org

reviews.cons: A lot of changes in short periods of time
reviews.pros: Pay is great and more than industry standards

reviews.cons: No L&D or benefits for learning,
reviews.pros: Committed leadership, good people overall

reviews.cons: Frequent management change and reorgs
reviews.pros: Lot of opportunities to grow

reviews.cons: There are no cons for me.
reviews.pros: The work environment is great. You have access to speak to senior leadership on a monthly basis and everyone is super friendly and willing to help. Remote work environment. Alot of work life balance and awesome benefits. The company really cares about it's employees.

reviews.cons: A lot of changes that aren’t benefiting the employees
reviews.pros: The team is really great

reviews.cons: It always seemed like ever changing business priorities
reviews.pros: Quartet pays very competitively for salary

reviews.cons: none at all! enjoy . its great
reviews.pros: great work environment for all

reviews.cons: low salary, low bonus, many hours
reviews.pros: good people to work with

reviews.advice: It’s truly unfortunate that Quartet is going downhill. Loss of salaries and benefits overnight with no warning, lack of transparency from the top down, and no accountability for the impact of layoffs. Many gave clear feedback during the last round of layoffs, which was completely disregarded by leadership yet again. The company does not value our efforts to make it easier for patients to connect to care. They are just focused on making money at this point, and it’s disappointing to see them cut corners to try to accomplish this. Truly unfortunate.
reviews.cons: -Limited to no opportunities for growth and development -Lack of transparency from leadership (even when they say that this is something they are working on) -Complete shift of company priorities to care delivery with no phase out plan for care connections -Regular abrupt layoffs
reviews.pros: -Remote work -Coworkers (incredible talent here) -Opportunity to directly improve outcomes for some patients

reviews.advice: Grow up. Listen to your employees. Let them know that they’re heard. Listen to your employees. Care about your employees. Listen to your employees.
reviews.cons: This company is inevitably sinking and no one wants to admit it. The management of the care navigation team is absolutely horrible. The managers have one way meetings and don’t allow care navigators or care support specialists to have voices. The team members are not allowed to ask questions during meetings and are told that if they do have questions to please go to their managers in their one-on-one meetings in private. Meanwhile, all of the Care navigation members talk crap about the managers in private slack groups. The morale of the team is incredibly low, the turnover rate is extremely high, and the managers “have no idea why.” When I started with quartet, the benefits were amazing and the morale of the team was high. But, gradually, the benefits have been taken away from the care navigation team and the work life balance absolutely sucks. Oh, but don’t worry, Care navigation managers get to keep their unlimited PTO, salaried wages, and great benefits. It’s in anyone and everyone’s best interest to avoid this sinking ship of a company. They have a great mission but they do an absolutely horrible job of executing it to patients in need of mental health services. Also, the cost of living has gone up and there’s been an increase in job responsibilities for the care navigation team, yet no increase in salary. If you’re looking for a job, look elsewhere. Trust me.
reviews.pros: My coworkers and remote job.

reviews.cons: limited opportunity for professional growth

reviews.cons:
- There's a lot of micro management because they are so focused on metrics. It creates extreme burnout, stress, and overall just a horrible time while at work. The metrics goals are not sustainable and unreachable. 

- The salary is laughable. For the type and amount of work that is required, they do not pay well. People make a lot more doing a lot less elsewhere. 

-The bonuses are also laughable. Almost impossible to attain because it's based on unrealistic goals. You have to work like a robot and still you may not reach them. Yet they wonder why no one's metrics are met. 

- Turnover rate is incredibly high. Management changes, poorly thought out metrics and workflows, and a lot of the jobs themselves are horrible to do. Always understaffed due to high turnover. 

- Out of Touch Leadership: Great lip service but that's about it. Employees are miserable yet leadership thinks everything is great. For Employee Appreciation Day, let's just say their show of appreciation became a running joke in the company.
reviews.pros:
Pros:
The coworkers are some of the nicest, well intentioned, true advocates of mental health you'll ever meet. 

Benefits are okay. Health plans are decent and they reimburse a lot of expenses. 

Pretty much it.
reviews.summary: Nice People but Horrible Expectations and Pay

reviews.cons: Quartet is struggling to find product market fit. Some of its products are useful and impactful , some are a solution in search of a problem.
reviews.pros: Small company , ability to make a big impact , learn a lot , and take charge of features / bug fixes. I generally liked all the people i worked with , especially the other engineers , but everyone else was hard working and cared about the mission. I don’t have a lot bad to say about the company . WLB was excellent. If you’re an early career engineer that wants to work on a mature product that still has a lot of feature work available, start here

reviews.advice: None! Continue working to promote transparency and a culture of One Team!
reviews.cons: None that I'm aware of at this time.
reviews.pros:
The company is very mission driven and you can feel that in every interaction. 
One of our core values is that we are One Team and you can truly feel that when working cross-functionally. 
Leadership has done an amazing job at taking previous feedback and implementing it to make them more available to employees by creating monthly office hours where employees can learn about what the strategy for that department looks like. 

In my 10+ years in the corporate world I can truly say that Quartet has been the best company I've ever worked for. I have never felt more valued in a corporate setting as I do at Quartet.

reviews.cons: Difficult team dynamics, uncertain product, unprofessionalism
reviews.pros: Good problem to solve, motivated people, and flexible

reviews.advice: There isn’t any advice the management team hasn’t heard, acknowledged and IGNORED. Its completely pointless to bring anything up because it’s routinely ignored or turned around and blamed on Care Navigation.
reviews.cons:
9/2022 UPDATE: Quartet is now taking away our unlimited PTO and our salaried positions. They are moving all of the Care Navigation/ Customer Support Staff team to hourly positions. They have given us 9 days notice and we will go without full pay while they do this. Quartet Health is the WORST company I have ever worked for. They lie, make up fake laws and only pay or reward upper management. THEY DO NOT CARE ABOUT MENTAL HEALTH AT ALL. 


They continue to advertise “unlimited pto”. However this just isn’t true. If you’re a manager or above then yes, have at it. If you’re on the Care Navigation team or the Customer Support Staff who answer phones they will not give you time off. 
They count literally everyday you are off and have a point system for those who they deem unworthy to use their “unlimited pto”. It’s now the WORST Pto plan I’ve had in 20 years in health care. 

They have also taken our 15 holidays a year and reduced it to 6. Which is well below the National average for holidays allowed per year. 

The management staff have absolutely no idea how difficult the roles are speaking to the patients on a daily basis. The burn out rate is very high due to their unrealistic metrics. Also- most patients are not cared for simply because they have the “wrong” insurance and Quartet doesn’t get paid. This place is a complete waste of time for most patients and employees. If you want to feel like the sludge at the bottom of a pond, join Quartet!
reviews.pros: The pros are pretty simple, you work from home. Which in all honesty isn’t such a pro anymore with so many companies offering this. That’s the only pro.
reviews.summary: Quartet Health; the mental health company that cares NOTHING about mental health!

reviews.advice: Treat your employees like you use to. Most of the great talent has left or is going to leave. Why be the Walmart of digital health when you could be Target.
reviews.cons: In my time with the company they have slowly chipped away at the benefits package they offered. When I first started unlimited PTO was standard along with other great benefits. We recently have been told that we will no longer be receiving such a benefit. Along with that they have changed us from a salaried position to hourly. It is in my opinion that Quartet no longer cares about the employees who do the brunt of the work and are more about the bottom line. I’d think twice before apply here.
reviews.pros:
- Coworkers
- Working from home
- Mission Driven

reviews.cons: No pay transparency within company. Lack of communication from higher up
reviews.pros: Good benefits, wonderful coworkers, good hours

reviews.cons: too much focus on brand over substance & products
reviews.pros: Fast paced environment; opportunities for growth and development.

reviews.cons: Management is mostly from traditional/large companies. Startup culture is slowly fading. Hiring for non-clinical roles has dried up.
reviews.pros: Has been an exciting place to work since its acquisition last year of Innovatel. Lots of new opportunities and initiatives that feel like we're heading in the right directions. Culture is very strongly positive.

reviews.advice: Grow up. Listen to your employees. Let them know that they’re heard. Listen to your employees. Care about your employees. Listen to your employees.
reviews.cons: This company is inevitably sinking and no one wants to admit it. The management of the care navigation team is absolutely horrible. The managers have one way meetings and don’t allow care navigators or care support specialists to have voices. The team members are not allowed to ask questions during meetings and are told that if they do have questions to please go to their managers in their one-on-one meetings in private. Meanwhile, all of the Care navigation members talk crap about the managers in private slack groups. The morale of the team is incredibly low, the turnover rate is extremely high, and the managers “have no idea why.” When I started with quartet, the benefits were amazing and the morale of the team was high. But, gradually, the benefits have been taken away from the care navigation team and the work life balance absolutely sucks. Oh, but don’t worry, Care navigation managers get to keep their unlimited PTO, salaried wages, and great benefits. It’s in anyone and everyone’s best interest to avoid this sinking ship of a company. They have a great mission but they do an absolutely horrible job of executing it to patients in need of mental health services. Also, the cost of living has gone up and there’s been an increase in job responsibilities for the care navigation team, yet no increase in salary. If you’re looking for a job, look elsewhere. Trust me.
reviews.pros: My coworkers and remote job.

reviews.advice: If a mistake is made, don't assume the worst and inquire to the person you are accusing instead of blindsiding them with punishment.
reviews.cons: Management lacks care for their employees and they use you when they need you but when you are no longer needed, say goodbye to job security. They make false promises and will blindside you with "transitions" by making decisions about YOUR job and its status behind your back. Not to mention, they lack genuine care for their patients unless they are contracted. Extremely money driven yet refuse to give raises despite increase cost of living. Continue to remove benefits such as unlimited PTO. Did I mention that you are never guaranteed time off even if you request it? Overall, as others have said, this company is going down. They have lost their transparency and specialty, becoming a corporate business driven outlook who does not care about their workers.
reviews.pros: The coworkers are extremely kind and willing to answer any questions you have, will help get you on your feet and truly care for you (unlike management/ those in higher level positions)
reviews.summary: Lack Of Care For Employees, Blindsiding Managers

reviews.advice: Complete overhaul of the culture.
reviews.cons: Everything is horrendous at Quartet
reviews.pros: Run! Do not work there. Management does not care about your well being.

reviews.advice: Advice? Does it matter???? You have had people leave ON THE SPOT with no jobs lined up, not waiting for bonuses because their mental health was suffering under your leadership. Then the employees that do stay with you, you blindside, use, and lie to. GIVE THAT EMPLOYEE HER EARNED MATERNITY LEAVE, YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELVES!
reviews.cons: WOW. Because WOW is the only reaction to how hypocritical this company is. They do not care about the mental health of their employees. To prove how heartless they are, during another round of layoffs they laid off an employee who is nine months pregnant! By the time she is due she won’t even be covered under health insurance anymore! I wonder how management would feel if they were in her shoes. Heartless and hypocritical are the only words I have for this company and everyone sitting in management. This is NOT the Quartet it used to be. The vision is blurred, most of the talent has left or been laid off and they do not care about patients who are not contracted with insurances Quartet makes money off of.
reviews.pros: There are no pros anymore. If zero stars were an option I would’ve chose it.

reviews.cons: Consistently re-organizing and re-structuring; loyalty not rewarded; current CEO (Puneet Singh) and other leadership failed to push the envelope, innovate, retain customers, or derive any profit; strong decline in company culture; lack of/minimal 401K matching
reviews.pros: Great work-life balance; good health insurance coverage; excellent mental health resources

reviews.advice: Honestly it's too far gone.
reviews.cons: So I'm re-writing my review from Jan 2022 where I said things were looking up-- LOL JOKES ON ME. The company has completely gone down hill, it is not profitable and their revised business model does not work. So there is absolutely no job security. They just went through a second round of layoffs in the two years I've been at the company, meaning things have just been getting worst. Leadership does not care about employees or company culture. This is not a mission driven company any more, they DO NOT even care or prioritize their own employees mental health so please tell me how the heck would they be able to care about other's mental health ? This place is a dumpster fire and it's truly sad. I'd stay away as you may end up unemployed in a short amount of time given the state of the business.

Not you, not the patients, nothing else. Benefits used to be great and got worse over time. The company does not value our efforts to make it easier for patients to connect to care. The CEOs, upper management and HR completely blindsided everyone else. The way they treated us when they did the lay offs last week was unbelievable, we weren’t given the opportunity to even say goodbye to co-workers who we’ve worked with for years! I truly feel like this company will no longer be around in a year. They are running out of money. Do yourself a favor and run far away from this place.

reviews.advice: Not worth wasting the words. They don't care. This will be explained as just another "disgruntled former employee."
reviews.cons:
EVERYTHING else.
No co culture. Killed when they ousted the former CEO. ERGs are defunct - they laid off everyone involved over the course of two years. No one cares enough about the company or culture to try.
Management decreases benefits about every 6 months. Raises are paltry. Everything from company holidays to vacation time constantly stripped back for non-leadership employees. Ask someone about the Juneteenth or maternity leave debates. It will tell you everything you need to know.
Continue to claim "start up" status only because they are floundering for a strategy they can monetize. Total lack a consistent roadmap, because the strategy is changes yearly. 
Ever-increasing workload shoveled on the few employees not laid off with no increase in compensation or titles. Employee stratification undervalues everyone except leadership. Use that that to refuse to compensate employees for the additional work demanded of them.
Commitment to DEI is a lie, especially at the leadership level. All management hiring based on knowing the existing management team. Very white, hetero, male. Don't let the current female CEO fool you.
HR team tries, but they are handcuffed by leadership. As long as an employee is "producing" or part of the leadership circle, bad behavior is excused. Repeat offenders sit on the leadership team, and the people that reported leave rather than fight a losing battle. 
If you want real nightmares, know they laid off people on maternity/paternity leave, and laid off an employee that was literally weeks from her due date. That is the leadership you're getting here.

reviews.cons: -The only major con of working here has been some of the uncertainty with lay-offs last year... However, the whole industry experienced similar things, and Quartet has adapted well and is moving forward leaner and stronger than ever, allowing for more runway to "make it." And it seems we finally have the right people on board.
reviews.pros:
-A lot of smart and dedicated people work here. However, the culture is not overly stuffy and there is no air of pretentiousness like at some start-ups / growth stage companies
-The mission of expanding access to quality mental healthcare is at the core of the business and most of the employees care greatly about this
-The work is interesting, as there are multiple product lines and plenty of analytically interesting challenges to overcome, as with any business striving for maturation and sustainable profitability
-The business is fully remote, and work-life balance is good. Even in busy times with long hours for a period of time, the flexibility of being remote to take breaks during the day and get things done later makes it bearable long-term

reviews.pros: Lot of opportunities to grow

reviews.advice: Keep up the great work! Continue to listen, be responsive, and value employees, clients, and patients as Quartet continues to grow. Staying flexible to respond to market needs and opportunities will ensure we remain successful.
reviews.cons: Honestly, I can't think of any major downsides to working at Quartet Health.
reviews.pros: Quartet Health is a fantastic place to work, and I get to work with a wonderful group of talented people. My direct leader creates a supportive environment, offering plenty of opportunities for continuous learning and growth, which makes me feel truly valued. The work we do here has a real impact, and it's incredibly rewarding to see the difference we make. Additionally, the senior and executive leadership genuinely listens to us, which is a rare and appreciated quality.
reviews.summary: A Great Place to Work with Amazing People

reviews.cons: Virtual-first working style isn't for everyone, but HR and leadership continue to find ways to foster a strong sense of community. There are regional meet-ups and budget for team building activities.
reviews.pros:
Quartet Health has a very mission & purpose-driven culture. The people who work here are passionate about improving access to quality healthcare for everyone. Each monthly all-employee Town Hall meeting starts with a Patient story to highlight the impact we're making in people's lives. Instances where employees demonstrate our Corporate values are also recognized each meeting.

There has been strong continuity among senior leadership the last few years and they have cast a compelling vision of the future to strengthen alignment at all levels on the pathway forward.
reviews.summary: Great place to make an impact in the communities we serve & grow your career

reviews.advice: Offer coaching to all associates in C-suite, Senior Leadership, and in Executive Support to better align messaging and execution, as well as to provide cohesive understanding of business etiquette.
reviews.cons:
- There are some associates who do not pull their weight in comparison to others (same as everywhere).
 - There are a handful of developing leaders who do not credit contributors as they should, which causes occasional resentment.
 - The business is constantly changing, resulting in burnout for some associates.
reviews.pros:

 - The salaries/benefits are competitive.
 - The teamwork in my area is probably the strongest and most supportive of any company I have ever worked at during my career.

glassdoor_result.summary_markdown:
# Employee Sentiments

## Reasons Employees Like Working at Quartet Health

### Positive Company Culture
- "I find myself incredibly impressed with the culture that Quartet has fostered." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2016-03-16)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW9945207.htm)
- "Quartet is a unicorn in the tech startup industry... It has a matured data/engineering/product team that is using live data and user feedback to drive roadmap decisions." [(Full Stack Engineer, Glassdoor, 2017-02-07)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW13672447.htm)
- "The company is very mission driven and you can feel that in every interaction." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-08-08)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW67678095.htm)

### Meaningful Work
- "Quartet is tackling a critical problem in mental health, and has brought in a great team to do so." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2018-01-01)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW18533216.htm)
- "The work we do here has a real impact, and it's incredibly rewarding to see the difference we make." [(Sr. Network Growth Manager, Glassdoor, 2024-08-02)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW89730439.htm)

### Supportive Environment
- "I generally liked all the people I worked with, especially the other engineers." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2022-06-25)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65974385.htm)
- "The vast majority of people working at Quartet Health are friendly, kind, and extremely hard-working." [(Assistance (Undisclosed), Glassdoor, 2024-09-04)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW90704306.htm)

## Reasons Employees Dislike Working at Quartet Health

### Poor Management and Leadership
- "Out of Touch Leadership: Great lip service but that's about it." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-06-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65911950.htm)
- "The management of the care navigation team is absolutely horrible." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2023-01-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW72645233.htm)

### High Expectations and Low Pay
- "The salary is laughable. For the type and amount of work that is required, they do not pay well." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-06-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65911950.htm)
- "Constantly micromanaged... The only thing that matters is numbers and metrics." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2023-07-11)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW78168938.htm)

### Employee Turnover and Morale
- "Turnover rate is incredibly high... Employees are miserable yet leadership thinks everything is great." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-06-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65911950.htm)
- "The morale of the team is incredibly low, the turnover rate is extremely high." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2023-01-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW72645233.htm)

## Key Events or Changes in the Company

### Changes in Benefits
- "Quartet is now taking away our unlimited PTO and our salaried positions." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2022-09-22)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW69354096.htm)
- "When I first started unlimited PTO was standard along with other great benefits." [(Care Navigator, Glassdoor, 2022-09-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW69384549.htm)

### Leadership Changes
- "The only major con of working here has been some of the uncertainty with lay-offs last year." [(Senior Manager, Glassdoor, 2024-06-20)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW88441725.htm)
- "Leadership seems reactionary and failure to commit to a single business strategy has led to several rounds of layoffs." [(Senior Customer Success Manager (CSM), Glassdoor, 2023-09-15)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW80108709.htm)

## Specific Details About Benefits

### Health and Wellness
- "Benefits are okay. Health plans are decent and they reimburse a lot of expenses." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-06-23)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65911950.htm)
- "Great pay and benefits. Unlimited PTO you can actually use." [(Software Developer, Glassdoor, 2024-09-05)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW90750878.htm)

### Retirement and Financial Benefits
- "The 401(k) match should be increased." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2022-04-27)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW63362467.htm)
- "No raise or cost of living adjustment in 2 years." [(Clinician, Glassdoor, 2024-04-11)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW86243574.htm)

### Work-Life Balance
- "WLB was excellent." [(Software Engineer, Glassdoor, 2022-06-25)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW65974385.htm)
- "The work environment is great. You have access to speak to senior leadership on a monthly basis." [(Anonymous, Glassdoor, 2024-05-07)](https://www.glassdoor.com/Reviews/Employee-Review-Quartet-Health-RVW87046000.htm)

# [Quartet Health Launches Innovative Whole Health Program to Improve Outcomes for Patients with Serious Mental Illness on 2024-03-19](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/)
Partnership with Clover Health Supports Underserved Patient Population With a New Whole-Person Care Delivery Solution

Quartet Health, a leading value-based behavioral health care enablement and delivery company, today launched their Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health, a physician enablement company, to better serve patients living with serious mental illnesses (SMI). The first-of-its-kind, whole-person care delivery solution is the only fully integrated physical and behavioral health model that takes accountability for the total cost of care (TCOC) risk on health plans’ most complex members, while also providing wraparound care services for a traditionally underserved patient population. The program was launched first in the New Jersey market.

“Patients with serious mental illness often have worse outcomes and a lower life expectancy, and they experience a fragmented healthcare system that does not adequately address their behavioral, physical, and social needs” said Dr. Michael J. Lipp, Quartet Health’s Chief Medical Officer, and former CMO of the CMS Innovation Center. Clover Health’s members with SMI average at least four different chronic conditions, with more than five different providers prescribing medications. Additionally, one in five members with SMI did not see a primary care physician (PCP) last year, and one in three did not see a behavioral health provider. “Patients often struggle to get access to care, and the care they do receive is often uncoordinated. This program will provide care that is coordinated, comprehensive and convenient, at no additional cost to patients.”

The partnership with Clover Health gives Quartet Health the opportunity to address the unique needs of this complex patient population with a health equity-based focus, through 24/7 care access, medication support, mental and physical care coordination, as well as local community resource and transportation support. Care teams – both in-market and virtual – will be led by nurse practitioners, trained in both mental health and family medicine, along with care coordinators, social workers, case managers, therapists, peers, and supervising psychiatrists and internal medicine physicians.

“For far too long, behavioral healthcare solutions for individuals living with SMI have not adequately accounted for the interconnectedness of both their physical and mental health needs,” said Christina Mainelli, Quartet Health CEO. “Patients are often forced to navigate an incredibly fragmented healthcare system, a system that fails to meet their needs, contributes to unnecessary hospitalizations and, ultimately, worse outcomes. That’s why it was so critical for us, in developing our Whole Health program, to take an approach that treats the whole person in a way that improves quality and patient outcomes, while also lowering the cost of care.”

“We’re confident that additional behavioral health support for our SMI cohort will increase the quality of life for these members, while continuing to reduce unnecessary spend,” said Brady Priest, CEO of Clover Home Care.

# [Network Growth Specialist - Quartet Health](https://www.builtinnyc.com/job/network-growth-specialist/260204)
Company Description:

Quartet is a leading tech-enabled behavioral health company that works with health plans, systems, and provider groups to deliver speed to quality behavioral health care for all. Through sophisticated data and analytics, along with personalized services, Quartet exists to advance quality care as defined by four measures: speed to care, seamless patient experiences, improved health outcomes, and affordability for patients.

innovaTel is a leading telepsychiatry provider dedicated to improving access to exceptional psychiatric care. innovaTel partners with clinical organizations to provide a range of services to both adults and children including psychiatric evaluations, therapy, medication management, patient education and consultations. In 2021, Quartet acquired innovaTel, and together we are delivering on our shared mission of enabling speed to quality mental health care for all. We are deeply committed to growing a diverse team and an equitable and inclusive culture where all Quartetians are empowered to be themselves and do their best work.

About the team & Opportunity:

Quartet’s Network Transformation team is responsible for building a curated ecosystem of mental health providers and delivering value to our payer customers, which starts with building strong relationships in each of our markets. Specifically, the team is tasked with creating, implementing, and scaling Quartet’s Care Connections product and setting mental health providers up for long term success. Network Transformation works closely with teams across the organization to ensure continuous innovation which includes close collaboration with Customer, Market Operations, Care Navigation, Product, Clinical, and Data teams. Our approach is “partnership” rather than selling, to align on joint pain points, value, GTM strategy, and product capabilities. Our partnerships require someone who enjoys a fast-paced, innovative environment with daily client interactions, as we build and scale across the organization.

The Network Growth Specialist will serve as a valued resource for Mental Health Providers (MHPs) within a group of markets that have been implemented and onboarded with Quartet. The Network Growth Specialist is a trusted partner and point of contact for Quartet’s MHP partners, reporting into the Senior Network Transformation Manager and partnering closely with internal Quartet teams to deliver operational excellence, manage client interactions and operations, and identify and address areas for improvement to support Quartet’s ability to consistently deliver value. The Network Growth Specialist will be responsible for owning the operational components for the MHP to drive success within our payer customer contracts and get patients to care faster. Payer customers rely on Quartet to report back on important care events to understand how quickly their members get into care and their clinical progression over time.

Accountabilities:

Serve as the face of Quartet for any providers (both referring entities and mental health clinicians) seeking platform support and troubleshooting

Maintain network adequacy through a comprehensive understanding of the active MHP network, including but not limited to account oversight, profile management, and performance monitoring

Ongoing “quality over quantity” by verifying MHPs’ National Provider Identifiers (NPIs) and state licensures to guarantee members are treated by fully licensed professionals

Monitor platform compliance to ensure MHPs are providing timely and accurate updates about the status of Quartet referrals, including submitting information on behalf of the practice if needed

Manage supply of MHPs by regularly reviewing unresponsive providers and declined referrals to proactively confirm members are getting to care quickly

Support the Sr. Network Transformation Manager in MHP re-engagement for accounts that need a platform refresher and deactivation for accounts that are no longer meeting quality standards

Conduct MHP follow-up for any feedback and/or complaints provided to Quartet by patients, referring providers, or payers

Assist with onboarding and credentialing net-new MHPs as needed

Minimum Qualifications:

1-3 years of experience in a customer service or operational role

Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to engage, build credibility, and create trust across all levels of an organization

Seek solutions beyond readily available information to meet providers’ unique needs

Strong data entry and data management skills, with impeccable attention to detail

​​Autonomous with demonstrated capability for problem solving, decision making, sound judgment, and assertiveness

Highly organized and effective at time management

Preferred Qualifications:

Previous experience working for a fast-paced start-up or healthcare consulting company

Flexibility and adaptability to accept the rapid changes inherent in Quartet’s growth-stage environment, with the ability to function independently and a bias towards action

A passion for expanding access to mental healthcare services

Previous experience with building new processes that require input from cross-functional teams in a project management, implementation, or related role

Highly proficient with MS office tools, especially PPT and Excel

Experience with Looker, or, similar BI tool

Experience working within a CRM system such as Salesforce

Our Benefits

​We're proud to offer the following benefits to our team members:

All roles are fully remote

Competitive compensation​

A​n unlimited PTO policy and paid holidays

Paid parental leave

​R​obust medical, dental and vision insurance plans

A 401​(k​) plan with employer match

Mental health benefits via our EAP

100% employer-paid life insurance​, short-term and long-term disability insurance

​Annual learning & development budge​t

# Comprehensive Analyst Report on Quartet Health

## Company Overview

Quartet Health is a tech-enabled behavioral health company that focuses on improving access to quality mental health care. The company collaborates with health plans, systems, and provider groups to enhance the speed and quality of behavioral health services. Quartet Health aims to deliver care defined by four key measures: speed to care, seamless patient experiences, improved health outcomes, and affordability for patients [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

This acquisition allows Quartet to offer a broader range of services, including psychiatric evaluations, therapy, medication management, and patient education [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

## Recent Developments

On March 19, 2024, Quartet Health launched its Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health. This innovative program aims to provide a comprehensive care delivery solution for patients with serious mental illnesses (SMI). It is designed to address the interconnectedness of physical and mental health needs, offering coordinated care that includes 24/7 access, medication support, and local community resources [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

Lipp, Quartet Health’s Chief Medical Officer, emphasized the importance of this program, stating, “Patients with serious mental illness often have worse outcomes and a lower life expectancy... This program will provide care that is coordinated, comprehensive and convenient, at no additional cost to patients” [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Partnerships and Collaborations

The partnership with Clover Health is significant as it targets a traditionally underserved patient population. The Whole Health program is the first fully integrated model that takes accountability for the total cost of care (TCOC) risk on health plans’ most complex members [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/). Christina Mainelli, CEO of Quartet Health, noted, “For far too long, behavioral healthcare solutions for individuals living with SMI have not adequately accounted for the interconnectedness of both their physical and mental health needs” [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Company Scale and Workforce

While specific employee numbers were not detailed in the articles, Quartet Health is described as a leading company in the behavioral health space, indicating a significant scale in terms of operations and workforce. The company is committed to building a diverse and inclusive culture, which is essential for its growth and operational success [(Tracxn, 2021-08-17)](https://tracxn.com/d/companies/quartet-health/__h0aWquU4iWJlxJchzH5LBsnUHhqRtzgJV8zFxkNd9ek).

## Product Information

The Whole Health program represents a major development in Quartet Health's product offerings. It is designed to improve outcomes for patients with SMI by providing a holistic approach to care that integrates both physical and behavioral health services. This program is particularly focused on addressing the needs of patients who often face barriers to accessing coordinated care [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Executive Insights

Quartet Health's leadership, including CEO Christina Mainelli and CMO Dr. Michael J. Lipp, play a crucial role in shaping the company's vision and strategy. Their insights into the challenges faced by patients with SMI highlight the company's commitment to improving healthcare delivery. Mainelli stated, “It was so critical for us... to take an approach that treats the whole person in a way that improves quality and patient outcomes” [(Quartet Health, 2024-03-19)](https://www.quartethealth.com/perspectives/quartet-health-launches-innovative-whole-health-program-to-improve-outcomes-for-patients-with-serious-mental-illness/).

## Conclusion

Quartet Health is positioned as a leader in the behavioral health sector, with a strong focus on integrating physical and mental health care. The recent launch of the Whole Health program in partnership with Clover Health marks a significant step in addressing the needs of patients with serious mental illnesses. As the company continues to grow and innovate, it remains committed to improving access to quality care and enhancing patient outcomes. 

For prospective candidates and investors, Quartet Health represents an opportunity to engage with a forward-thinking organization that is actively working to transform the behavioral health landscape.
